result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven B Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Attorney Fees To Be Determined. Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Order for DNA to be scanned to the jail for Defendant.   Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven B Wright

records.addlTxt: Letter from Clerk of Courts RE:  Fines/payments and reply from Account Technician MN

12:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven B Wright appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Steven B Wright. 

12:18  Court relates and gives appearances.
12:18  Atty. Firkus relates.
12:19  Court questions defendant.  12:22 Court questions  Atty. Firkus. 
12:23  State relates.
12:23  Atty. Firkus relates.  12:23 Defendant makes statement.

Count #1: Defendant pleads guilty; Court finds factual basis to accept plea and finds defendant guilty of same.
Pay costs; 60 days to pay.
Order for DNA to be scanned to jail for defendant. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample. 

(MS scanned to jail)

1:06 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven B Wright appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Steven B Wright. 
Warrant is quashed.  Attorney Firkus relates to the court reasons for missing court.  

State moves to Reinstate bond.  Court grants and orders same.  

Must appear in person if a criminal plea.    Can appear by zoom if amended to ordinance.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven B Wright
Current: 2759 23 1/2   Street Apt #2, Rice Lake, WI 54868   (Effective: 04-14-2022)
Prior: 2218 25th St, Rice Lake, WI 54868

11:00 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven B Wright not in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Steven B Wright. 

State moves for bench warrant; body only; Wisconsin.  Court grants.

11:40 AM Prosecuting attorney John A Rafa Todd appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Steven B Wright appeared by video, Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Steven B Wright. Attorney Firkus relates on communication issues.  11:40 a.m. Defendant and Attorney Firkus put in a breakout room.  Case to be recalled. 11:43 a.m. Back on the record.  Attorney Firkus relates formal reading waived and not guilty plea entered. Hearing set and may appear by Zoom.  Address confirmed and phone number updated. Bond continues.
Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

01:32 PM Defendant Steven B Wright in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond for today.  Defendant Steven B Wright in custody.  Brian H. Wright appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven B Wright appeared by zoom video means with Attorney by zoom video means.
Qualifies for Public Defender.  Reading of Complaint waived.  State relates.  Attorney Raymond relates.  Bond set.  Next hearing may be by zoom.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
